function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Exclusion of communicable diseases from the review may overlook the impact of greenspace on disease transmission and propagation.","Impact":"Failure to consider the impact of greenspace on communicable diseases could result in ineffective public health interventions and disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Include a review of the literature on the impact of greenspace on communicable diseases to better understand the relationship and inform public health strategies.","Technologies":"Literature review, data analysis, epidemiological studies","People":"Public health researchers, policymakers, urban planners","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Exclusion of mental health from the review may neglect the potential mental health benefits of greenspace, impacting overall well-being and quality of life.","Impact":"Failure to account for the mental health benefits of greenspace may lead to incomplete assessments of its overall impact on health outcomes.","Mitigation":"Incorporate a review of the literature on the association between greenspace and mental health to comprehensively evaluate the health benefits and inform policy decisions.","Technologies":"Psychological assessments, mental health surveys, observational studies","People":"Mental health professionals, policymakers, community organizations","Owner":"Research institutions, government health departments"},{"Description":"Limited scope may result in overlooking the impact of greenspace on certain health outcomes, leading to incomplete evidence for decision-making.","Impact":"Failure to consider all relevant health outcomes associated with greenspace exposure may result in suboptimal planning and resource allocation for public health interventions and urban development.","Mitigation":"Expand the scope of the review to include a broader range of health outcomes related to greenspace exposure and its potential benefits.","Technologies":"Systematic reviews, meta-analyses, comprehensive literature searches","People":"Public health researchers, urban planners, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, government health departments"}]}
